unnormalised: Planning a trip within India? You've probably heard of IndiGo, SpiceJet, and Air India, right? These are the big players, but let's be real, choosing between them can be a bit of a headache. Everyone's got their own experiences, and prices fluctuate more than Mumbai's weather. My last SpiceJet flight, SG 203 from Delhi to Goa on 10/10/2023, was delayed by 2 hrs! Luckily, I had packed some snacks.

My last SpiceJet flight, S-G two hundred and three from Delhi to Goa on tenth October two thousand and twenty three, was delayed by two hours! Luckily, I had packed some snacks.

unnormalised: Air India's been trying to revamp things, especially after the Tata takeover. They're promising better service and newer planes. I saw a news report saying they ordered like, 470 new aircraft! But honestly, their on-time performance is still kinda iffy. Plus, their website can be a pain to navigate – sometimes I swear it's stuck in the 90s. I've heard their AI 505 flight from Mumbai to Kolkata usually lands around 9:30 PM, but check the schedule before you prepone your dinner plans.

Plus, their website can be a pain to navigate, sometimes I swear it is stuck in the nineties. I have heard their A-I five hundred and five flight from Mumbai to Kolkata usually lands around nine thirty P-M, but check the schedule before you prepone your dinner plans.

unnormalised: Then there's IndiGo. They're usually the most punctual and have the most flights, especially on popular routes like Bangalore to Chennai. Flight 6E 101 lands at 8:30 AM sharp! Their customer service is generally pretty good, but their seats can feel a bit cramped, especially on longer flights. Remember when they offered tickets for Rs. 999? Those days are long gone, though!

unnormalised: Don't forget the smaller airlines too, like Vistara (if you're feeling fancy) or AirAsia India. They might have fewer routes, but sometimes they offer better deals. Always compare prices on sites like MakeMyTrip or Cleartrip – you might find a steal! I once got a Vistara flight from Guwahati to Delhi for only Rs. 3500 during monsoon season. Score!

unnormalised: Ultimately, the "best" airline depends on your priorities and budget. Check for baggage allowance, read reviews, and most importantly, book in advance, especially during festival seasons like Diwali or Holi. Safe travels, yaar!
